Description: Fragment from a painted cartonnage mummy-case, comprising the lower part of the proper left side of the case. The fragment is decorated with polychrome decoration, including the feet of a goddess at the top and the head of a kite (identified as Nephthys) below. Along the edge is a vertical line of hieroglyphs within a polychrome border. The text names the Prophet of Amun in Karnak, Great Controller who keeps the city in check Penoupoqer, justified. This man was named as the father or grandfather of the actual owner of the mummy-case, whose name is not preserved.
Condition: fair (fragmentary, edges have lost some surface and the larger piece is cracked)
Acquisition name: In Memory of: Horace A Owen
